result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christy R. Boyd

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM/ RM 203. Defendant Christy R. Boyd appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. wishes to waive right to an attorney and has not yet filed waiver form. Court reviews waiver of attorney form orally with Def. and Def. constitutional rights. Court finds Def. is competent to represent self and is entering freely and voluntarily. State notes 22CM110 should also be called. Court also calls case no. 22CM110. Appearances are the same in both matters. Def. also wishes to waive attorney in 22CM110. Court finds Def. is entering freely and voluntarily. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Def. waives time lines on P.H. Court receives waiver of time limits on P.H. State will be sending an offer to Def. and requests Court take plea from Def. on 22CM110. Court reviews charges on 22CM110. Def. stands mute and Court enters Not Guilty plea. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls @ 3:43 PM/ RM 203, 22CF202 & 22CM110. Defendant Christy R. Boyd appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's and notes Def. has applied for PD Office in 22CM110, Court reviews appointment of counsel report. In 22CF202, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. wishes to represent self. Court orders Def. to fill out waiver of atty. form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
